comments.author: Brian
comments.body: I stand humbled before greater men...although I'm pretty sure it won't keep me from talking smack as needed.

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: As Steve and I waited for the runners just above Heartbreak Hill, I fished around in my jersey pocket and found an old dog-eared copy of Finigan's Wake that I'd been meaning to read. I was just past page 456 when Steve said he heard the runners coming up the trail... but it was just the Nature Appreciation Group from Golden West Nursing Home. They said they had passed the runners back down around the Bouldering Rocks, and they would probably crest the hill sometime after the war in Iraq was over. We really wanted to wait around for the guys, but I had to get back to town in order to catch my great grandson's college graduation. So we headed back down... Wonder if they're at the top yet.

comments.author: Rob
comments.body: I think I speak for the honorable Brian Kent as well when I ask, "How many gears, Steve? How many speeds does that fancy bike of yours have?" My running shoes... well, one speed is all I need. Well met today on Flagstaff. Next time....beware!!!

comments.author: Terry
comments.body: well according to my HRM i spent 45 minutes above my target zone and only 5 minutes in the zone. that's good, right?! ;-P while i must admit to being last to the top (behind the runners), i can say w/o question i was first/fastest one down. you guys will make a roadie out of me yet -- NOT! until next time. terry
